pullRequest.body:
Deliver on one of the open TODOs and establish the behavior of `MeromorphicAt.order` under addition. 

This material is used in [Project VD](https://github.com/kebekus/ProjectVD), which aims to formalize Value Distribution Theory for meromorphic functions on the complex plane.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@loefflerd All done. Thanks, as so often, for your time & patience.

:v: kebekus can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Thanks :tada:

bors d+
Thanks!

Looks great now! I spotted one more tiny typo.

maintainer delegate
This looks great! I've posted a few comments with localized shortcuts, etc, which you could use if you like â€“ nothing major.

Looks great now! I spotted one more tiny typo.

maintainer delegate

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

bors d+
Thanks!

```suggestion
If two functions agree on a punctured neighborhood, then one is meromorphic iff the other is so.
```
I would suggest making `{f : ð•œ â†’ E}` a global variable in this file to avoid repetition
Implemented, ditto for the symbols `fâ‚`, `fâ‚‚`, and `x` used throughout the file.

golf:
```suggestion
  simp [hf.meromorphicAt_order, (by rfl : (0 : WithTop â„¤) = (0 : â„•âˆž).map _)]
```
There are some TODOs in comments in this file which are done in this patch, can you please remove the todo notes?
Done.

```suggestion
  Â· rw [hâ‚‚fâ‚, min_top_left, (hfâ‚.add hfâ‚‚).order_congr]
```
(& similarly in next case)

```suggestion
    filter_upwards [hâ‚ƒgâ‚, hâ‚ƒgâ‚‚, self_mem_nhdsWithin]
    simp_all [g, â† smul_assoc, â† zpow_add', sub_ne_zero]
```

```suggestion
  have tâ‚ : tâ‚€.order = n := (tâ‚€.order_eq_int_iff _).mpr âŸ¨1, analyticAt_const, by simpâŸ©
```
This suggests that the `n` argument to `MeromorphicAt.order_eq_int_iff` should be made implicit â€“Â the general rule is that arguments to `iff` statements should be implicit if they are inferrable from either side of the `iff`.

```suggestion
  refine âŸ¨gâ‚ + (Â· - x) ^ (nâ‚‚ - nâ‚) â€¢ gâ‚‚, ?_, ?_, ?_âŸ©
```
and then the `constructor`'s further down are not needed.
Done.

Something weird is happening with the hypothesis `h` here: after these `lift` statements the infoview shows three different hypotheses called `h` shadowing each other. (Not your fault at all, of course!)
I saw that, and I have no idea what is going on. Black magick, most like.
I opened a zulip thread about this, but it has no bearing on the review process for this PR so there is no need to wait.

```suggestion
  Â· simpa [zero_zpow _ <| sub_ne_zero.mpr (WithTop.coe_lt_coe.1 h).ne']
```
I suggest using `min_le_left` rather than the standard library's `Int.min_le_left` (& similarly for some other `Int.xxx` lemmas in this PR)
Done.
you don't need to specify the type explicitly in `self_mem_nhdsWithin` because it can be inferred from the goal
Done.

```suggestion
  rcases lt_or_lt_iff_ne.mpr h with h | h
  Â· simpa [h.le] using hfâ‚.order_add_of_order_lt_order hfâ‚‚ h
  Â· simpa [h.le, add_comm] using hfâ‚‚.order_add_of_order_lt_order hfâ‚ h
```
(There is a `wlog` tactic which is supposed to handle cases like this, but I couldn't get it to work here.)

```suggestion
The order of a sum is at least the minimum of the orders of the summands.
```

```suggestion
  by_cases hâ‚‚fâ‚ : hfâ‚.order = âŠ¤
```

```suggestion
  by_cases hâ‚‚fâ‚‚ : hfâ‚‚.order = âŠ¤
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: behavior of MeromorphicAt.order under addition
